svg.content: <mxfile userAgent="Mozilla/5.0 (Macintosh; Intel Mac OS X 10_13_1) AppleWebKit/537.36 (KHTML, like Gecko) Chrome/69.0.3497.100 Safari/537.36" version="9.2.4" editor="www.draw.io" type="google"><diagram></diagram></mxfile>

div.style: display: inline-block; font-size: 12px; font-family: Helvetica; color: rgb(0, 0, 0); line-height: 1.2; vertical-align: top; width: 70px; white-space: nowrap; overflow-wrap: normal; text-align: center;

display: inline-block; font-size: 12px; font-family: Helvetica; color: rgb(0, 0, 0); line-height: 1.2; vertical-align: top; width: 391px; white-space: nowrap; overflow-wrap: normal; text-align: center;
div.div:
components/Play.vue (for the /play route)
show feedback toast from widget
loading animation
decide which sample ID is served to the user
Save user's responses, update their score, update the sample's summary

div.style: display: inline-block; font-size: 12px; font-family: Helvetica; color: rgb(0, 0, 0); line-height: 1.2; vertical-align: top; width: 345px; white-space: nowrap; overflow-wrap: normal; text-align: center;
div.div:
components/WidgetSelector.vue
if statements that map config.widgetType to a WidgetComponent
and routes any emitted events from its child

div.style: display: inline-block; font-size: 12px; font-family: Helvetica; color: rgb(0, 0, 0); line-height: 1.2; vertical-align: top; width: 625px; white-space: normal; overflow-wrap: normal; text-align: center;

ul.li: load data as a function of widgetPointer(an item from config.manifestURL), widgetProperties
decide how to render depending on if widget is in playMode or not
the "showTutorialStep(integer)" method to selectively highlight parts of the widget in the tutorial mode
"getFeedback" method to tell the user if they did a good or bad job as a function of user's response, widgetSummary
"getScore" method as a function of getFeedback, returns an integer to add to the user's score for leaderboard
"getSummary" method to update a summary of that sample's annotations as a function of user's response (e.g. update the running average rating for the sample)
"vote": a method that emit's the "widgetRating" event to the parent component, with the user's input as the payload. The schema of the user's input is up to the author of the widget
